revised_title: Induced Representations of the Bondi-Metzner-Sachs Group
tldr: The authors demonstrate that Cantoni's representations of the Bondi-Metzner-Sachs group, which were previously constructed using infinitesimal methods, can be derived from an inducing procedure based on the supertranslation subgroup. This method leads to induced representations in the nuclear topology and provides a more transparent understanding of Cantoni's construction. The authors also find the representation and decomposition for zero and negative mass squared cases, showing that the inducing procedure starts with a reducible representation of the little group.
